column2: MASSACHUSETTS DMV TEST
column4: Massachusetts
column6: MA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your eyes off the road
column6: take your attention away from driving
column8: take your hands off the wheel

column2: 2. These are:
column4: regulatory signs.
column6: miles-left signs.

column2: 3. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before the traffic light turns red.
column6: after you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 4. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column4: brown and white.
column6: green and white.

column2: 5. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
column4: get some coffee.
column6: get an energy drink.

column2: 6. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 7. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column6: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column10: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 8. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column6: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: Shopping centre ahead.
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column8: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column10: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 10. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: switch to daytime lights.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column10: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

column2: 11. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 12. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 13. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column10: watch for children and be ready to stop.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: No parking

column2: 15. This sign indicates:
column4: the entrance to a construction site.
column6: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column8: that you must not drive past this sign.
column10: that you must yield the right-of-way.

column2: 16. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They don’t have rearview mirrors.
column6: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 17. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column6: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column8: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.
column10: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.

column2: 18. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column4: the pedestrian might be blind.
column6: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 19. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: Tranquilizers.
column6: A cold remedy.

column2: 20. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.
column6: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: swing to the right side of your lane.

column2: 21. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.
column6: check your rearview mirror.

column2: 22. Aggressive drivers:
column4: are high risk drivers.
column6: run stop signs.
column8: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.

column2: 23. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 24. This sign indicates:
column4: Do not use your phone while driving
column6: Cell phone shop ahead

column2: 25. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: stay in their lane.
column6: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
